tutorial.title: Touch Events
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to use touch events on your websites.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
Let's learn to apply touch events to a webpage so that users can trigger an action. Press and hold the dog and see what happens.

Note: the following lessons will only be interactive on touch displays.

lessons.title: Function
lessons.interactiveContent:
We use touch events to determine whether a user has interacted with a webpage element and then use a function to perform a specific action.

Let's create a function that adds the text "Whoff!" to an element once a touch event happens.

Make sure to pick function followed by displayMessage and then touchstart, displayMessage.

lessons.title: Touch start
lessons.interactiveContent:
When we want to check whether users have begun to interact with an element, we use the touchstart event.

Let's set the code to run the function immediately when a user touches the image element.

Make sure to pick touchstart.

lessons.title: Touch move
lessons.interactiveContent:
When we want to determine whether a user has interacted with an element for a prolonged time, we use the touchmove event.

Code touchmove to run the function when a user moves their finger across the image element.

Make sure to type touchmove.

lessons.title: Touch end
lessons.interactiveContent:
To check whether a user has stopped interacting with an element, we use the touchend event.

Let's make the text disappear when a user removes their finger from the image element.

Make sure to pick touchend.

lessons.title: Touch cancel
lessons.interactiveContent:
Finally, it's good coding practice to check if a touch event gets interrupted using the touchcancel event.

Code touchcancel, and then while touching the image, swipe your finger off the screen to interrupt the touch event.

Make sure to type touchcancel.

lessons.title: Question: Function
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when a user touches the element of ID age?

The text 30 is added to the bio elementThe text Male is added to the bio element

The text 30 is added to the bio element.

lessons.title: Question: Touch start
lessons.interactiveContent:
What touch event is triggered when a user begins to interact with an element?

The touchstart eventThe touchmove event

The touchstart event.

lessons.title: Question: Touch move
lessons.interactiveContent:
When is the touchmove touch event triggered?

When a user interacts with an element for a prolonged timeWhen a user starts to interact with an element

When a user interacts with an element for a prolonged time.

lessons.title: Question: Touch end
lessons.interactiveContent:
When is the touchend touch event triggered?

When a user stops interacting with an elementWhen the user double touches the element

When a user stops interacting with an element.

lessons.title: Question: Touch cancel
lessons.interactiveContent:
What event do we use to check whether a touch event has been interrupted?

We use the touchcancel eventWe use the touchend event

We use the touchcancel event.

lessons.title: Example: Function
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the value that makes the code display "Biton Bag" after a user touches the image element.

Make sure to type displayName.

lessons.title: Example: Touch start
lessons.interactiveContent:
Next, code the touch event value to check whether a user has begun interacting with the image element.

Make sure to type touchstart.

lessons.title: Example: Touch move
lessons.interactiveContent:
Check whether a user has moved their finger across the image element by coding the correct touch event value.

Make sure to type touchmove.

lessons.title: Example: Touch end
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the touch event to check whether a user has stopped interacting with the image element.

Run the code and press on the image for a long time and then release to call the function displayName.

Make sure to type touchend.

lessons.title: Example: Touch cancel
lessons.interactiveContent:
Lastly, to adhere to best coding practices, code the touch event to check whether a touch event has been interrupted.

Then try touching the image to see when the event takes place.

Make sure to type touchcancel.
